Looking at the code structure, there's a TODO comment in the part where (s/k) equals b. The code is supposed to print the array elements here. But if n is larger than 1, the loop needs to output n-1 zeros, and then the last element would be s. Wait, no, because in this case, the sum of the array must be s, and all elements except the last one are zero. Because if we have the array where most elements are zero except one which is s, then each a_i divided by k would sum to s/k, which is exactly b. So that's correct.

So in the for loop for the case where s/k == b, we need to print n-1 zeros followed by s. But the current code in the loop is empty. So the missing code here is to print 0 followed by a space.
